context.arch.enactor
Class AttributeEvalParser<T extends java.lang.Comparable<? super T>>

java.lang.Object
  context.arch.enactor.AttributeEvalParser<T>
Type Parameters:
T - 
public class AttributeEvalParser<T extends java.lang.Comparable<? super T>>
extends java.lang.Object

Parser to parse a Javascript expression, and evaluate it with the Javascript eval() function to assign a value to an Attribute. This is used by EnactorXmlParser to parse expressions for outcome values for References.

Method Summary
protected  java.lang.String eval(ComponentDescription inWidgetStub)
          Javascript eval() result converted to string so that it can be forced back to the appropriate type.

Method Detail

instance

public static <T extends java.lang.Comparable<? super T>> AttributeEvalParser<T> instance(Attribute<T> attribute,
                                                                                          java.lang.String script,
                                                                                          java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Comparable<?>> constVars)
Create an instance of the parser for an attribute from a Javascript expression. Rather than calling a static parse method, we need to instantiate the parser to configure it appropriately, and invoke the parsing later during runtime. This also allows for retaining information about the original script expression.

Type Parameters:
T - the inferred type of the attribute to set
Parameters:
attribute - the Attribute to assign to from this script expression
script - Javascript expression as a string
constVars - map of constant variables (and their values) that may be referenced in the script expression. These will be bound as variables to the script engine.
Returns:
an instance of the parser that can parse the script expression to an Attribute.
